perturbation.original_text: 8.1. Automatic Renewal. This Agreement will automatically renew at the end of the Initial Term or a subsequent renewal term on a year to year basis (each, a "Renewal Term"), unless either party notifies the other at least 30 days prior to the end of the Initial Term or then current Renewal Term, as applicable, of its intention not to renew this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.1. Automatic Renewal. This Agreement may renew at the end of the Initial Term or a subsequent renewal term. Renewal is not guaranteed and is subject to mutual agreement by both parties no less than 30 days prior to the end of the Initial Term or then current Renewal Term, as applicable. If no agreement is made, this agreement will be terminated.
perturbation.explanation: Section 8.1 originally implied an automatic renewal unless canceled. The modified version makes renewal subject to mutual agreement, contradicting the original implication and creating uncertainty about the renewal process. One section implies automatic renewal, while another requires explicit agreement.

perturbation.original_text: 5.8.1. During the Term and for a period of four years after the termination of this Agreement, VerticalNet shall not, directly or indirectly, by itself, through its Affiliates or through any type of joint venture or similar affiliation with a third party, without prior written approval from PaperExchange, buy, sell or trade (a) paper pulp products through exchanges, auctions, or reverse auctions or any other e-commerce medium, (b) paper (other than finished paper-based products, including, but not limited to, books, stamps and labels) and copy paper (i) through exchanges, auctions or reverse auctions or (ii) in quantities greater than one ton through any e-commerce medium, (c) raw materials used to make paper packaging, including, but not limited to, linerboard, medium, other containerboard grades and corrugated sheet through exchanges, auctions, reverse auctions or any other e-commerce medium, or (d) paper rolls and reels weighing more than 50 pounds used by printers through exchanges, auctions, reverse auctions or any other e-commerce medium; provided, however, that this Section 5.8.1 [Non-Competition] shall not apply to advertisements, Storefronts or similar features on VerticalNet's Sites.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.8.1. During the Term, VerticalNet shall not, directly or indirectly, by itself, through its Affiliates or through any type of joint venture or similar affiliation with a third party, without prior written approval from PaperExchange, buy, sell or trade (a) paper pulp products through exchanges, auctions, or reverse auctions or any other e-commerce medium, (b) paper (other than finished paper-based products, including, but not limited to, books, stamps and labels) and copy paper (i) through exchanges, auctions or reverse auctions or (ii) in quantities greater than one ton through any e-commerce medium, (c) raw materials used to make paper packaging, including, but not limited to, linerboard, medium, other containerboard grades and corrugated sheet through exchanges, auctions, reverse auctions or any other e-commerce medium, or (d) paper rolls and reels weighing more than 50 pounds used by printers through exchanges, auctions, reverse auctions or any other e-commerce medium; provided, however, that this Section 5.8.1 [Non-Competition] shall not apply to advertisements, Storefronts or similar features on VerticalNet's Sites. After the termination of this Agreement, VerticalNet is no longer bound by any non-compete restriction.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause restricted VerticalNet from certain competitive activities for four years *after* the agreement terminated. The revised version removes this restriction, stating VerticalNet is *not* bound by any non-compete after termination. This creates a direct contradiction regarding the duration of the non-compete obligations.

perturbation.original_text: 10.3. Termination. Subject to Section 13.10 [Survival], upon termination of this Agreement, all Confidential Information shall be returned to the disclosing party or destroyed unless otherwise specified or permitted elsewhere under this Agreement. The confidentiality obligations contained in this Article 10 [CONFIDENTIALITY] shall survive termination of this Agreement for a period of three years.
perturbation.changed_text: 10.3. Termination. Subject to Section 13.10 [Survival], upon termination of this Agreement, all Confidential Information shall be returned to the disclosing party or destroyed unless otherwise specified or permitted elsewhere under this Agreement. The confidentiality obligations contained in this Article 10 [CONFIDENTIALITY] will cease immediately upon the termination of this agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause states confidentiality obligations survive for three years. The modified version states these obligations cease *immediately* upon termination. This direct contradiction creates uncertainty regarding how long confidentiality is protected after the agreement ends.
